name: Feedbucket – Website Feedback Tool
author: Feedbucket

sections.description:
Feedbucket is built for ambitious web agencies to save time and headache by always getting screenshot or video with client feedback. Straight into their project management tool.

Stop getting feedback on your website in emails, spreadsheets or powerpoints. Instead enable your clients and team members to, without leaving the browser, submit high quality feedback with screenshot or recording plus other metadata like browser, device and so on.

No more emails “It doesn’t work” which leaves your team like “What doesn’t work? What browser were you using?”

Save on average 5 hours per project by getting feedback that you directly understand and can take action on!

How Feedbucket works

When Feedbucket is installed on your WordPress site it enables visitors to submit feedback using annotated screenshots directly in their browser without registering or downloading an extension.

For those harder to explain bugs or animations the visitor can record their screen. Again, all in the browser without the need to install any third-party software or extensions.

Together with the screenshot or recording comes a lot of metadata like browser, device, resolution and so on. No more emails to the client asking what browser they are using.

The feedback will flow straight into your existing project management tool. Feedbucket is not “yet another tool” that you and your team need to log into. Handle everything from the tools you already use.

Integrations

You do not have to use an integration but if you do, all feedback will go into your current project management tool.

Feedbucket is built using 2-way communication which means that you can resolve, comment and so on directly from your project management tool. This means that your team do not have to log into Feedbucket but can handle everything from the tool you already use.

More integrations are added all the time but use these
– GitHub
– Trello
– JIRA
– Notion
– Teamwork
– ClickUp
– Asana
– Zapier

The WordPress Plugin

  • Install Feedbucket without any coding skills in 30 seconds. Show Feedbucket on the frontend and/or the admin panel.
  • Only show Feedbucket for logged in users or users belonging to a certain group. This means that you can use Feedbucket in production as well.
  • Feedbucket can auto-fill the name for the reporter if a user is logged in.
sections.faq:
What is Feedbucket?

Feedbucket is a tool that gets installed on your WordPress site to enable your clients and team members to submit feedback using screenshots or recordings straight into your project management tool.

Can I use it for free?

You can have one project for free to use as much as you want. Check out our pricing for more information.

How to I get started?

Go to feedbucket.app to create your free account and get started in 60 seconds.

Will it slow down my site?

Feedbucket is loaded asynchronously so it will not slow down your site.

Does it work with WooCommerce?

Yes, it works with WooCommerce
sections.changelog:
= 1.0.2
* Adding the Feedbucket script using new method to try and fix the issue that the script sometimes didn’t load.

1.0.1

  • Using the new window object to automatically set the reporter.
  • Using data-feedbucket instead as a key on the script.

1.0.0

Initial release
sections.screenshots:
1. Submit feedback using annotated screenshots directly on the website.

  2. Submit feedback using video recordings without installing any extensions.

  3. See the screenshot that you, or others, have submitted.

  4. Get the feedback straight into your project management tool.
sections.reviews:
You've tried the rest - this is the winner!

By davemgraham on December 30, 2022

We've probably purchased, used or tested the majority of tools on the market for getting website feedback and Feedbucket has to be the best!

It's super simple to set up and gathering text feedback, image uploads, or video is a breeze.

There's no need for browser extensions (that confuse your clients).

It has superb two way integration with a whole suite of tools (which most other tools don't have).

If you're looking for a way to get client feedback on a DEV or LIVE site straight into your task tool - this is it.

Clients can even see the feedback they submitted, and when it's resolved right on their website.

Great work guys!

A great timesaver!

By nilsfridlund on October 21, 2022

We save time while improving our quality by making feedback easy to understand and complete using Feedbucket. Anyone who wants to streamline their feedback should use Feedbucket!

Great tool, a must have!

By meridiq on October 11, 2022

So happy we found this tool, save us so much hassle in sending screenshots and updates to the web agency. Have been using this without the Wordpress plugin for some time, but the plugin gave us the option to use in live environment. Cool that you can activate this with different roles so you can limit the people making feedback and suggestions on the design. We use Feedbucket in live environment as we change the site continuously. Free plan without limitations is rare to find, where other similar tool only have 14 day trials. A final word though. This is a tool for sending feedback to developers from testers, so do not confuse with client feedback forms. Also I would say that Feedbucket works best with the integrations (we use Teamwork) that you can connect.
